snippet: At least three people were killed in powerful explosions that devastated stores and homes northeast of Kabul, police and hospital officials said.
abstract: Afghan officials say powerful explosions of oil and gas tankers at a depot on the northeastern outskirts of Kabul devastated stores and homes and left at least three people dead and more than 80 injured; police have not identified the exact cause of the explosions, including whether they were accidental or related to terrorist activity.

byline.original: By GRAHAM BOWLEY and JAWAD SUKHANYAR
byline.contributor: An employee of The New York Times contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: At least three people were killed in powerful explosions that devastated stores and homes northeast of Kabul, police and hospital officials said.

headline.main: Deadly Blasts at Afghan Oil and Gas Depot
headline.print_headline: Oil and Gas Tankers Explode at Depot on Outskirts of Afghan Capital
